column4: Preview: Bulls at Jazz

Things have been even worse for the Jazz  who have lost six straight and own the worst record in the NBA.

column4: Blackstone to pursue La Quinta IPO rather than sale: source
column5: Blackstone Group LP  is eyeing an IPO for La Quinta Inns & Suites rather than a sale of the hotel chain  according to a source familiar with the process.

column4: Blackstone to pursue La Quinta IPO rather than sale -source
column5: Nov 25 Blackstone Group LP is eyeing an IPO for La Quinta Inns & Suites rather than a sale of the hotel chain  according to a source familiar with the process.

column4: PDVSA's oil exports to Citgo decline  U.S. oil firms buy more -EIA
column5: HOUSTON  Nov 25 Venezuela's state-owned oil company PDVSA is sending less of its crude to its U.S. unit Citgo and some of the slack is being picked up by other U.S. oil firms such as Valero Energy and Chevron   according to the Energy Information Administration.

column4: Wal-Mart veteran McMillon to replace Duke as CEO next year
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc  has named company veteran Doug McMillon to be its next chief executive  in a bet that his experience running its international unit will bolster growth at the retailer  the world's largest.

column4: UPDATE 4-Wal-Mart veteran McMillon to replace Duke as CEO next year
column5: * Outgoing CEO Mike Duke to remain as adviser for one year

column4: US STOCKS-Dow ends at record high; Nasdaq loses grip on 4 000
column5: NEW YORK  Nov 25 The Dow industrials eked out a slim gain on Monday to end at another record high  after the Nasdaq topped 4 000 for the first time in 13 years and then slipped to close below that level.

column4: RPT-US STOCKS-Wall St flat after Nasdaq tops 4 000; Wal-Mart at record
column5: NEW YORK  Nov 25 U.S. stocks retreated to almost unchanged in light trading late Monday afternoon following the Nasdaq Composite's climb above 4 000 for the first time in 13 years.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall St flat after Nasdaq tops 4 000; Wal-Mart at record
column5: NEW YORK  Nov 25 U.S. stocks retreated to almost unchanged in light trading late Monday afternoon following the Nasdaq Composite's climb above 4 000 for the first time in 13 years.

column4: Wal-Mart names McMillon to replace Duke as CEO
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc  named the head of its international division  Doug McMillon  to replace Chief Executive Mike Duke  who will retire on January 31 after five years at the helm of the world's largest retailer.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall St edges up on Iran deal  but energy weaker
column5: NEW YORK  Nov 25 U.S. stocks rose modestly on Monday as a deal between world powers and Iran eased tensions in the Middle East  though the agreement also weighed on oil prices and energy stocks.
